You need to configure the dashboards while minimizing required customizations.

Which tool should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate tools to the correct dashboards. Each tool may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

A company's human resources director wants a solution that improves consistently for the process of onboarding new staff. The company wants to use playbooks for the solution.

You need to create a playbook template to track the staff onboarding.

In which entity must you create records for staff members?

discussion.content:
B is correct
Playbook can be applied to Account, Contacts, Lead, Opportunity, Orders, Quote and Invoice.

1. You can not create playbook template for user entity
2. its about onboarding process of employees, all employees does not necessarily to be created as user (which requires certain D365 license for the user to even appear as a user in D365), So employees has to be manages using contact or custom entity.

You can not add playbooks for a custom entity too, so "Contact" only is the answer.
Staff will still be a Contact record. Correct

Selected Answer: B
I was thinking user aswell but it kind of a trick question no? Since you cant create playbooks on the user entity. 

The playbook capability is currently enabled only on Lead, Quote, Opportunity, Order, Invoice, Account, and Contact record types. As a playbook manager, when you create a playbook template, you can select which entity that playbook applies to.

So I think B is correct.

Selected Answer: C
This entity is used to store information about users in an organization, such as employees and contractors
Playbooks can not be applied to resource entity. Contact is the solution

comments.content: Bookable resource entity is only available with Field Service or Project Operations. Not available with Sales, also BR is only for resources needs time booking ETC i.e. FS engineers etc. Using it for all employees might not make sense,
